svcproc.title: CAB AIR SUSPENSION system for 9200 i/9400 i/9900 i DAY CAB MODELS WITHOUT DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES after DECEMBER 2001

warning.para: For safety purposes cab air suspension must be supplied from a pressure protected air supply.

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 108 for Items in parentheses.

The cab air suspension system for the 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i day cab models without Detroit Diesel engines after December 2001 contains one air spring (bag) (Item 5), two shock absorbers (Items 6 and 7), and is controlled by the height control valve (Item 8). The air suspension assembly (Figure 108) needs no lubrication and very little maintenance.

The following components - air line (to air spring) (Item 14), hex nipple fitting (Item 12) and elbow fittings (Items 13 and 26), air spring (bag) (Item 5), height control valve (Item 8), shock absorbers (Items 6 and 7) and lateral control rod (Item 4) - should be checked at the time the truck is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve (Item 8), air spring (bag) (Item 5) and shock absorbers (Items 6 and 7) are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Height Control Valve

note.para: If there is an attempt to disassemble or adjust fittings on the height control valve (Item 8, Figure 108) , it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from air system, be sure to set parking brake and/or block vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 109 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Loosen compression nut (Item 1) and pull air line (supply) (Item 2) from elbow fitting (Item 13) in "SUPPLY" port of height control valve (Item 5).
Loosen compression nut (Item 3) and pull air line (to air spring) (Item 4) from elbow fitting (Item 14) in "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 5).

Remove height control valve linkage (Item 6) from threaded ball pivot (Item 31, Figure 108) by unlatching linkage clip and carefully pry the height control valve linkage socket from threaded ball pivot on height control valve arm (Item 7).
Remove two hex head bolts (Item 8) and hex lock nuts (Item 16, Figure 108) and remove height control valve (Item 5) from mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 9).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Air Suspension Shock Absorber
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 108 for Items in parentheses.

step2.para: Remove hex head bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 18 and 20) at the top and bottom of shock absorber (Item 6).
Remove shock absorber (Item 6) from between cab mounting plate (Item 1) and crossmember mounting plate (Item 3).
Remove hex head bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 18 and 20) at the top and bottom of shock absorber (Item 7).
Remove shock absorber (Item 7) from between cab mounting plate (Item 1) and crossmember mounting plate (Item 3).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Air Suspension Air Spring (Bag)

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from air system, be sure air system is drained and be sure to set parking brake and/or block vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 108 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Loosen compression nut of elbow fitting (Item 13) and pull air line (to air spring) (Item 14) from elbow fitting at the top of air spring (bag) (Item 5).
Remove elbow fitting (Item 13) from hex nipple fitting (Item 12) at top of air spring (bag) (Item 5).
Remove hex nipple fitting (Item 12) from top of air spring (bag) (Item 5).
Remove hex head bolt (Item 21) and lock washer (Item 23) at the top of air spring (bag) (Item 5) at cab mounting plate (Item 1).
Remove socket countersunk flat head screw (Item 22) at the bottom of air spring (bag) under crossmember mounting plate (Item 3).
Slide air spring (bag) (Item 5) from between cab mounting plate (Item 1) and crossmember mounting plate (Item 3).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Lateral Control Rod
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 108 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove lateral control rod (Item 4) as follows.

step2.para: Remove hex head bolt (Item 24) and hex lock nut (Item 25) from mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 3) and lateral control rod (Item 4).
Remove hex head bolt (Item 24) and hex lock nut (Item 25), not visible in (Figure 108) from cab mounting plate (Item 1) and lateral control rod (Item 4) and remove lateral control rod.
